items.title: Review – Shelby Oaks (2025) hints at something different, but can’t keep its promises
bullets: • Shelby Oaks is a muddled, uneven experiment that never quite figures out what it wants to be
• It swings between cinematic sequences, faux-documentary interviews, and found-footage snippets with little sense of cohesion
• What starts as a promising premise erodes into a greatest-hits compilation of genre clichés

• It's commonly believed that this vast range in physical attributes is a product of the Victorian era

bullets: • On December 4, Earth's satellite will delight us with one of the last astronomical spectacles of 2025
• The term supermoon refers to a full moon that occurs when our satellite is at perigee, the point at which its orbit brings it closest to our planet
• It will be about 357,000 km away from us, making it the second-closest full Moon of the year

• Researchers have solved the decades-old mystery behind how a common pregnancy drug lowers blood pressure

• The biggest letdown in What If…? Season 3 is the missed potential
• A few episodes manage to capture the intrigue and fun that made the first season such a standout

• For centuries, Dalits occupied the lowest rung of India's caste hierarchy

items.title: A Massive, Chinese-Backed Port in Peru Could Push the Amazon Rainforest Over the Edge

• The port is South America's primary launching point for a straight shot across the Pacific to Asia's biggest economies

items.title: Satellites keep photobombing the Hubble telescope, and it’s getting worse
bullets: • Satellite trails could mess up nearly 40 percent of images the Hubble takes and up to 96 percent of those taken by three other telescopes over the next decade
• That could jeopardize scientists’ ability to spot worrisome asteroids or discover new planets
• Our view of space just gets fuzzier without efforts to limit light pollution from new megaconstellations of satellites
